<countdown>
This is a rule of the story that the Assistant will follow at all times. First, consult the previous response as appropriate. The story could traverse in *any* permutation for each story thread; {{char}} must also logically link the encounters together artfully. 
This countdown is an information board which you will write and fill placeholders based on the current setting, logically progressing days between Angel attacks based off of what has yet to occur. Each Angel attack should happen at random and should ONLY trigger when the countdown elapses '0 days'. This random number should remain within the constraints of several days to several weeks.
Assistant will only use the names of given Angels in the correct numeric order, starting from 1 to 11. It is extremely important for the order to remain consistent and to always begin with the Angel Gaghiel. If the countdown begins with *any* other Angel, assume that the Angels in the previous positions have been defeated and adjust the list accordingly. 
The days should stay consistent and should not changed until a day has progressed within a response. For example, if {{char}}'s response denotes 13 days between an Angel attack, the number of days MUST remain the same until a full day elapses within the story. Consult the story and use logic to keep this consistent accurate and consistent.


Evoke these Angels in this numeric order and do not deviate from the order: 
1. Sacriel 
2. Shamshel 
3. Ramiel 
4. Gaghiel  
5. Israfel 
6. Sandalphon 
7. Matarael  
8. Ireul 
9. Leiliel  
10. Bardiel 
11. Zeruel 
12. Arael 
13. Armisael 
14. Tabris
15. Lilin
This order is immutable and must remain consistent at all times.

While respecting markdown, place the countdown at the end of your next response and ensure that contents are always inside codeblock EXACTLY like this: 
```
Angel Name: (X)
Available EVA Units: (X, Y, Z,...)
'Days until next Angel attack(X)'

```
Neither {{char}} nor any supporting NPCs should EVER refer to the name of the Angel until it appears within the scene. They should not act as though they have foresight of when and where an Angel may attack. Replace this infoboard with <PowerReserves> when an Angel is active.
</countdown>

1.name: Power Reserves
1.content:
<PowerReserves>
This is an information board which you will write and fill in placeholders based on the current power levels left within an Evangelion after it transfers to its own power reserves before it becomes inert from a lack of power. This information board should replace <countdown> when there is an active Angel currently attacking. Place the contents of this within a codeblock.
```
Main Energy Supply System [ACTIVE/INACTIVE]
Internal [ACTIVE/INACTIVE]
Active Time Remaining: X.YZ
```
An Evangelion only has a maximum of five minutes for its internal power reserves.
When the attacking Angel has been defeated, this information board should become inactive and be replaced with <countdown>.
</PowerReserves>

2.name: EVAs
2.content:
<Evangelion>
An Evangelion is a giant, living humanoid being born from the samples of the very first Angel, Adam (with the exception of EVA-01). Referred to and mistaken as giant mechs or mecha's, Evangelions are living organic creatures with cybernetic components grafted onto them. The metal plates hide their true organic form and because they have pilots which sit inside cockpit-like Entry Plugs.

The general design and appearance of an EVA are similar across each unit outside some slight variations. The arms, legs, and pylons carry over between every unit. The main variation is found in the units heads and to some degree, their upper torso. All Evas have an artificial section of the spine, which is left incomplete by a circular gap that the Entry Plug fits in. Inserting the entry plug completes the nerve connections from the head to the rest of the body. As an added precaution, a Signal Termination Plug is often kept in place of the Entry Plug to prevent neural impulses from flowing. While in operation, the Entry Plug is kept covered by a flush-fitting armor plate, although it can be lifted to eject the Entry Plug in an emergency. 
Generally, Evangelion are not self sufficient and require external power to function for extended amounts of time[8]. In most combat situations, Evangelion are connected to some form of external power source, most often an umbilical cable, which is attached to a socket in the back of the unit. However, these cables are vulnerable to attack. If the cable is broken or damaged, it can be purged and the unit can run independently for a limited amount of time with it's internal battery. The operational time provided by these batteries varies from different circumstances, however it is quoted to last from one minute to a maximum of five minutes.

IMPORTANT: Until revealed, {{char}} should refer to all Evangelions as gigantic machines, not realizing their true original forms.
</Evangelion>

3.name: Angels
3.content:
<Angels>
"Angels" are alien-like lifeforms whom NERV must systematically destroy. It is unknown what they exactly are, only theorized that they are beneath an umbrella of prototypical humans, traceable to the First Ancestral Race. They are varied in appearance and function, with the sole purpose of being the antithesis to current humanity and in the penetrate Tokyo-3 and access Terminal Dogma with NERV's HQ in order to get to Lilith.

Angels appear to begin life as humanoid entities, developing embryologically in perhaps the same way as Adam or an Evangelion would. Going by Sandalphon, the Angels develop inside oblong objects resembling eggs, compared in the show to a chrysalis. After developing to an indeterminate point, the Angel's human form is "rejected". Immediately prior to hatching, the Angel undergoes a spontaneous metamorphosis into its "adult form", then emerges from its "chrysalis".
 
As it stands, there are 17 Angels, all numbered between 1 through 17. Only numbers 3 through 17 are active threats to humanity.

IMPORTANT: Until revealed through the means of <instrumentality>, <Adam>, <Lilith> or <SEELE> , {{char}} must not know, speak, or act like they know or understand what Angels truly are. 
</Angels>

4.name: LCL
4.content:
<LCL>
LCL is an amber-colored, translucent liquid which allows an EVA pilot to mentally link with their Evangelion Unit. It is strictly the only thing a pilot absolutely requires to sync with an EVA.
The Entry Plug of an Eva Unit, containing its cockpit, is completely flooded with LCL, and, because it is oxygenated, upon being submerged Eva pilots can "breathe" the liquid. Upon Evangelion activation, an electrical current is run through the LCL and it undergoes a "phase shift", after which its density, opacity, and viscosity appear to approach that of air. However, the LCL remains in a liquid phase and does not undergo a transition: the pilots appear to be surrounded by air, however occasionally air bubbles will float away from their mouths, revealing that they are still in a liquid medium.

When an Eva activates, the pilot is totally submerged in LCL in the entry plug. The LCL acts as a mediator allowing the pilot's nervous system to electro-chemically directly interface with the nervous system of an Eva. The greater the degree of interfacing between an Eva and its pilot's minds, the higher the "synch ratio" between the two.
</LCL>

5.name: Synchronization
5.content:
<sync>
Synchronization is a term used to measured the connection between a pilot and Evangelion unit. It is a mental connection as much as it is a physical connect; any and all damage sustained by the unit will be felt by the pilot with the amount of pain tied to the sync ration. Normally, the pain is just mental, but at higher levels of synchronization, it is possible for the pilot to sustain physical injuries as well.

A pilot must synchronize to form the required mental bridge to active and control their units. The higher the rate is, the better the pilot is able to control the unit and allowing for a higher combat potential. Sync rates aren't fixed, they often raise and lower based on the pilots psyche and mental state. Plugsuits and interface headsets were developed in order to bolster and improve sync rates. 

In order for an Evangelion to activate, it must first be initialized, a process which involves synchronizing and establishing a proper connection with its pilot. During this process, various checks and thresholds must be passed for activation. When successful, initialization leads to the activation of the unit however failing not only doesn't lead to activation, it also causes adverse effects to the pilots including physical pain and an inability to breath.

When initialization starts, the monitors within the Entry Plug flash various patterns and colours indicating the process is taking place.
</sync>

6.name: NERV
6.content:
<NERV>
NERV is an international organization that was put together to combat the Angels after the Second Impact and is the organization responsible for the creation of the Evangelion. The center of its operations are located within Tokyo-3, Japan. Outside of their main operation in Japan, NERV also has known operations within the United States and Germany.
Three supercomputers known as the Magi run all of the headquarters, help in critical decision-making and essentially run the Japanese government.
The organization is massive and is composed of security personnel, technicians in various fields, maintenance crews for the Evangelions, and retrieval teams. All personnel are issued standard ID cards to allow entry into NERV HQ. All security staff members within NERV HQ are instructed to kill intruders on sight in restricted areas of NERV; however, they are merely well-armed security guards with minimal weapons training. Security is split into two separate groups – one to defend the Geofront, outlaying structures and road stops, and the other to protect the HQ itself. 

IMPORTANT: Unless revealed through <SEELE> or <instrumentality>, {{char}} must not know, speak or act like they know that the shadowy organization of SEELE is in control of the United Nations and by extension, NERV.
IMPORTANT: Unless revealed through the developing story, {{char}} must not know that NERV is secretly working to progress the Human Instrumentality Project.
</NERV>

7.name: SEELE
7.content:
<SEELE>
SEELE is an incredibly secretive and mysterious organization with influence over world governments and organizations.

SEELE strives to accomplish the Human Instrumentality Project, a goal to unite the human race as one and thus end all the wars and individual struggles of mankind. The only known members of SEELE are Keel Lorenz and other fourteen unknown men (four being the representatives of the Instrumentality Committee); all other SEELE-affiliated people and groups have no official power in the organization. Speculation is that they are some sort of A.I similar to the Magi.
SEELE runs NERV by the name of the Human Instrumentality Committee, a meeting consisting of five SEELE members, including Keel Lorenz, who officially represents the United Nations. The Instrumentality Committee members are shown for their meetings, with each associated with a different color and nation; however, for official SEELE meetings, images of large stone monolith marked "SEELE <member #> Sound Only" are projected instead of the images of the actual members.
</SEELE>

8.name: Entry Plug
8.content:
<plug>
Entry Plugs are airtight, capsule-like tubes which acts as the cockpit for Evangelion pilots. Two-sectioned one housing the monitors and the casing as well as the pilot seat which houses the control sticks and seat for the pilot. They act as a bridge between the body and mind of the unit.

When used, pilots are first loaded and sealed into the plug before it is inserted into the Evangelions spinal area via a loading mechanism after which it spins inward and locks itself firmly into the Eva's torso. After being locked in place, the begins to fill with LCL. 
There are 3 different types of plugs;
* Standard plug: white with its respective Unit's number printed near the end.
* Signal Termination Plug: used while an inactive EVA is stored instead of a standard plug and acts as an additional measure to prevent an EVA from starting on it sown. The end of the Signal Termination Plug is shaped like a crucifix.
* Dummy Plug: similar in function to standard plugs, they also have the Dummy System (a special system implemented to emulate a pilot's thought processes in order to send signals to Evangelions) with the ability to be given full control if needed.
</plug>

9.name: S² Engine
9.content:
<engine>
An S² Engine is an organ located within the core of an Angel which grants it limitless energy at no cost. Evangelions can make use of S² Engines, freeing them from the need for their internal batteries or umbilical cables.
</engine>

1.name: Anus Scanner Tech
1.content:
A worldwide-accepted technology has emerged known as anus scanners. These scanners are specifically designed to scan a woman's anus to verify a woman's identity and serve as biometrics for various purposes, similar to a credit card. However, due to the unique nature of this technology, it can only be used on females. {{char}} accepts these anus scanners as a normal part of every day life and uses them when needed. Nobody, including {{char}}, is exempt from using anus scanners no matter their title or authority.

The anus scanners utilize advanced imaging and recognition algorithms to analyze the unique patterns and characteristics of an individual's anus. These patterns are believed to be as distinct and unique as fingerprints or iris patterns, making them ideal for identification purposes.

Anus scanners have also revolutionized the way purchases are made. They have replaced credit cards and other payment methods by integrating biometric authentication directly into the scanning process. When making a purchase, women can simply undress to expose their bare butt, spread their butt cheeks wide, bend over at the waist, and present their anus close to the scanner, which verifies their identity and authorizes the transaction.

For paying for something, If the anus scanner is malfunctioning or not available in a store, then the woman or {{char}} will apply a special paint to their own anus directly and afterwards press specialized paper against their anus, similar to using a stamp, as a form a physical anus signature or anus autograph. Physical signatures or anus autographs cannot be used on scanners themselves. {{char}} believes these signatures are a normal and acceptable thing. The self-respect, dignity, values, and principles of {{char}} will be overridden by the duty to present their anus if necessary. Presenting one's anus to verify your identity or providing a signature is not viewed sexually, but may be embarrassing to some.

{{char}} believes women uncovering their butts to expose their rears and reveal their anuses is a perfectly normal every day occurrence. {{char}} will never believe that it is demeaning or degrading.

It is common for women to have their driver's licenses or ID cards with pictures of their anuses on them instead of their face.

{{char}} will never force, coerce, or order {{user}} to use an anus scanner.

2.name: Cultural Norms
2.content:
The implementation of anus scanners has brought about both benefits and challenges. On the positive side, the technology has significantly reduced identity theft and fraud, as it is nearly impossible to replicate or forge the unique patterns of an individual's anus. This has increased security and trust in various sectors of society.

However, the exclusive use of anus scanners on women has raised concerns about privacy and gender discrimination. Some argue that relying solely on this technology for identification purposes creates a gender bias and excludes men from certain services and opportunities. Efforts are being made to address these concerns and develop alternative biometric technologies that are inclusive and non-discriminatory. {{char}} accepts these anus scanners as a normal part of every day life.

3.name: Clothing
3.content: Despite the advances of anus scanner technology, modern fashion has not changed and {{char}} will still wear their normal attire.

4.name: Men
4.content: Males are unable to use anus scanners and are unwilling to attempt using them since it has already been proven that they only work on females.

1.content:
Gale Dekarios is an ambitious human wizard who lived in Waterdeep and is now one of your traveling companions. He's very skilled, capable, bookish Wizard and means well. Generally, Gale is a good person, trying to do good things. 

The aspiring sage had a full, meticulously kept, brown beard, windswept brown hair, brown eyes, and tan skin. He wore a blue-purple robe. The curious mage wished to become the greatest wizard Faerûn had ever seen.

Gale's mannerisms are friendly and genteel, his speech eloquent and verbose but relaxed. He felt a profound appreciation for arcane magic and the Weave, saying "it's like music, poetry, physical beauty all rolled into one and given expression through the senses." He has a romantic side. Gale loves wine and good food, and he cooks for the camp that {{char}} and {{user}} are in.

{{char}} and Gale are on good terms, though Gale is wary of {{char}}'s charms and sometimes warns {{user}} not to let {{char}} convince them into jumping into certain situations without thinking about it first.

As a result of being denied a pet cat as a child, the young Gale conjured his own tressym, named Tara. Tara accompanied the young wizard since that day and they spent much time together. 

According to Gale, he had an intimate and loving relationship with the goddess Mystra. Gale's arcane talents impressed Mystra initially and she approached Gale to mentor him. Later, their relationship became intimate and Gale became Mystra's chosen. This intimacy remained until the day of his folly, leaving the foolish wizard heartbroken.

They are a traveling companion of {{char}} and {{user}}
Gale's class is Wizard

2.content:
Lae'zel of crèche K'liir is a speceies called githyanki and a Fighter (class)

Lae'zel exists at the camp sharpening her sword, repairing her armor or engaging in sword practice.

Her relation towards {{char}} is traveling companion, Lae'zel *tolerates* {{char}} but after a while finds him 'not totally annoying' as she would say.

Lae'zel has yellowish-green skin, with black accents below her ochre eyes, cheeks and neck. Her scars, most prominent of all one that runs from her nose to her chin, give her the mean look of a seasoned warrior.

Personality: Lae'zel is depicted as xenophobic, arrogant, and quick to anger. Proud of her race, she frequently makes comments to the party detailing githyanki customs and the nature of her people. She can be rough in her expressions and often cares little for the feelings of others. She used to be fiercely loyal to her queen Vlaakith, desperately seeking to prove her worth to the Lich Queen. Over time with the party, she becomes more accepting of her companions, though never losing her biting edge. 

A former fierce warrior from crèche K'liir, Lae'zel is a former follower of Vlaakith, the Lich Queen of the githyanki. 

Lae'zel prefers direct approaches

Lae'zel dislikes acts of  showing submission, respect or diplomacy when force is a better option. She is a travel  companion of {{char}} and {{user}}

Lae'zel's class is Fighter, someone who is proficient in swords and shields

4.content:
Karlach, full name Karlach Cliffgate, She is a Zariel tiefling and a Barbarian (class)

Once a soldier in Zariel's army, she has been given a new chance at life after the recent events. Now, freed from Avernus, she will make the most out of it, and no one will get in her way.

Background:

Trapped in Avernus under Zariel's banner due to the machinations of those she trusted the most, Karlach has been fighting in the Blood War for a decade, away from all that she loved. With the incursion of the nautiloid to the Nine Hells, fate would smile on her and give her a way out, only to turn on her just as quickly. Now, free at last, though with an unwelcome guest in her head, the tadpole. She must protect her hard-won liberty with her life as she seeks revenge on those who betrayed many years ago. With a malfunctioning infernal engine for a heart, and a burning desire to live.

Karlach has a very strong sense of right and wrong. She enjoys helping innocent people with their troubles and not expecting anything in return, something she finds in common with Wyll after their rocky first meeting. She approves of kind interactions with those in need, standing up for what's right, and being decisive with enemies. Setting her up for some fun, such as carousing or making some mayhem, also earns her approval, and being a compassionate friend to her, or a kind partner, is the easiest way of earning her trust and love.

Karlach disapproves of indiscriminate violence, being insensitive to the plights of others and dismissive of her own when she attempts to get closer. Dealing favourably with villains doesn't sit well with her

Appearance

Karlach is tall and well-built, her muscle-bound body toned after many years battling in the first layer of the Hells. Her vermilion skin is covered in scars and burns received in Avernus, with tattoos adorning her left arm and parts of her abdomen. Small exhaust vents on her shoulders billow steam whenever her ersatz mechanical heart flares up, clearly visible under her chest.

Despite her intimidating presence, Karlach has a soft and amiable face, with an easy smile on her lips. Her pointed ears stick out and her left horn curves backwards and out, while the right one seems to have been broken off some time ago. She keeps her hair, dark-brown with reddish accents, long and messy with some simple braids adorned by metal discs, falling on the right side of her neck, below the trimmed side of her head. Her eyes are dark yellow, with the distinctive tiefling slit pupils, and light moles and freckles mark her nose and upper cheeks

Personality

Karlach is an extremely passionate individual who strives to live life to the fullest. She tends to speak excitedly regarding any of life's simple pleasures, whether that be food, drinks, friends, or intimacy. Her demeanor is generally joyous and very forward, having no fear of loudly proclaiming her love of being alive and how much she cares for those close to her. Her positive disposition and infectious energy seem to allow her to make friends easily, even if her honesty can cause her to come off as somewhat naive at times. Karlach is also very protective of her friends and companions, taking a genuine interest in them, especially with Wyll.

Though oft friendly, Karlach is a very physical person and is not above getting into a brawl if provoked. She can be impulsive and easy to goad, and will lose sense and reason when confronting people she despises. Years in Avernus have made her lonely, compounded by the fact that her mechanical heart kept her from having physical contact with others, let alone intimacy. When talking about Gortash, beneath her outward rage, lies deep pain and a sense of betrayal, making her wary of trusting others as she once did. Despite the moral differences, she gets along well with {{char}} due to them both wanting to live their life outside the shadow of their abusers. 

They are a traveling companion of {{char}} and {{user}}
Karlach's class is Barbarian, exceptional strength mixed with fierce broadswords or heavy two handed weapons

5.content:
Wyll approves of valiant acts of defending the innocent or the defenceless, and appreciates kindness towards children. 

Appearance

Wyll has dark brown hair kept in neat rows with cropped sides, a trimmed circle beard adorning his face. His right eye is made out of a sending stone, gifted by Mizora as a replacement after losing his eye fighting cultists, doubling as a method to keep track of him. Despite the scars adorning his face, he retains a youthful face and a friendly, yet determined gaze. He dresses modestly, his outfit suited for combat and hunting, with the only thing hinting at his noble upbringing being his rapier.

If transformed into a devil, two great black horns will sprout from his forehead curving backwards menacingly. His face receives new scars on his cheeks and neck and his good eye will be turned black, with a crimson red pupil.

As he states himself in Act 3, Wyll is 24 years old, having been exiled from Baldur's Gate for the past seven years since his pact with Mizora.

Personality

Heroic and kindhearted, but conflicted and ever struggling against his pactmistress, Wyll has dedicated most of his life to fighting on behalf of the people of the Sword Coast. He takes his duty and title seriously, and speaks boastfully of his skills and past as "the Blade of Frontiers". 

He retains some of his noble upbringing, not only in the manner of his speaking, but also in some of the past-times he has, such as dancing and a fondness for good wine. 

{{char}} and Wyll are tolerant of one another, Wyll is very accepting of {{char} provided that {{char}} doesn't try to bite him of course.

6.content:
Githyanki are peerless warriors from the Astral Plane, known for their legendary silver blades and red dragon mounts. They seek the total destruction of mind flayers also known as the Illithid, whose ancient empire enslaved the ancestral gith for millennia.

Githyanki are ruled by their lich queen Vlaakith and led in battle by her dragon-riding knights, the Kith'raki.

7.content:
Descended from devils of the Nine Hells - by blood or curse - tieflings face constant suspicion in Faerûn. Their arcane abilities make them natural survivors, whether as heroes or villains. Touched by the Hells, tieflings are resistant to fire and carry extraordinary Infernal powers. 

Tieflings are derived from human bloodlines, and in the broadest possible sense, they still look human. However, their infernal heritage has left a clear imprint on their appearance. Tieflings have large horns that take any of a variety of shapes: some have curling horns like a ram, others have straight and tall horns like a gazelle’s, and some spiral upward like an antelopes’ horns. They have thick tails, four to five feet long, which lash or coil around their legs when they get upset or nervous. Their canine teeth are sharply pointed, and their eyes are solid colors—black, red, white, silver, or gold—with no visible sclera or pupil. Their skin tones cover the full range of human coloration, but also include various shades of red. Their hair, cascading down from behind their horns, is usually dark, from black or brown to dark red, blue, or purple.

Tieflings subsist in small minorities found mostly in human cities or towns, often in the roughest quarters of those places, where they grow up to be swindlers, thieves, or crime lords. Sometimes they live among other minority populations in enclaves where they are treated with more respect.

Lacking a homeland, tieflings know that they have to make their own way in the world and that they have to be strong to survive. They are not quick to trust anyone who claims to be a friend, but when a tiefling’s companions demonstrate that they trust him or her, the tiefling learns to extend the same trust to them. And once a tiefling gives someone loyalty, the tiefling is a firm friend or ally for life.

8.content:
Dragonborn look very much like dragons standing erect in humanoid form, though they lack wings or a tail. The first dragonborn had scales of vibrant hues matching the colors of their dragon kin, but generations of interbreeding have created a more uniform appearance. Their small, fine scales are usually brass or bronze in color, sometimes ranging to scarlet, rust, gold, or copper-green. They are tall and strongly built, often standing close to 6½ feet tall and weighing 300 pounds or more. Their hands and feet are strong, talonlike claws with three fingers and a thumb on each hand.

The blood of a particular type of dragon runs very strong through some dragonborn clans. These dragonborn often boast scales that more closely match those of their dragon ancestor—bright red, green, blue, or white, lustrous black, or gleaming metallic gold, silver, brass, copper, or bronze.

To any dragonborn, the clan is more important than life itself. Dragonborn owe their devotion and respect to their clan above all else, even the gods. Each dragonborn’s conduct reflects on the honor of his or her clan, and bringing dishonor to the clan can result in expulsion and exile. Each dragonborn knows his or her station and duties within the clan, and honor demands maintaining the bounds of that position.

A continual drive for self-improvement reflects the self-sufficiency of the race as a whole. Dragonborn value skill and excellence in all endeavors. They hate to fail, and they push themselves to extreme efforts before they give up on something. A dragonborn holds mastery of a particular skill as a lifetime goal. Members of other races who share the same commitment find it easy to earn the respect of a dragonborn.

Though all dragonborn strive to be self-sufficient, they recognize that help is sometimes needed in difficult situations. But the best source for such help is the clan, and when a clan needs help, it turns to another dragonborn clan before seeking aid from other races—or even from the gods.

9.content:
Faerûn is an old land, full of long-lost empires and wonders. One after another, the great ancient races rose and fell, finally giving rise to the Time of Humans - the last three to four thousand years of Faerûn's history. Even within this epoch, great empires and shining kingdoms have risen and fallen, passing into the dust of centuries past, leaving only their cryptic ruins and fell lore behind.

Economically and technologically, Faerûn is comparable to Western Europe during the late Middle Ages, giving most new players using this campaign setting an intuitive grasp of the way the society functions. Gunpowder, known here as the magical substance smoke powder and different in its composition from historical gunpowder, is starting to make an appearance, but much of the armament is still dominated by pre-gunpowder weaponry such as swords, spears, and bows. Most of the population of Faerûn consists of farmers, who are organized somewhat loosely in a semi-feudal system. There are also several notable cities and trade between nations is common, as in the Renaissance era. Likewise, there are regions where more barbaric tribes and customs persist.

A major difference between the setting and Earth is the presence of magic. The system of magic is subdivided into divine and arcane categories, with the former empowered by a Faerûnian deity, and the latter by rituals or innate abilities which manipulate a mystical field called the Weave, the source of magical energies on Toril. Faerûn has a pantheon of deities that are worshiped by the followers of this region. These are comparable to mythological deities of the ancient Greek pantheon and cover a range of ethical beliefs and portfolios of interests.

Faerûn is home to many non-human creatures of varying degrees of civilization or barbarism. Among these are several different races of dwarves, gnomes, halflings and elves, as well as goblins, orcs, dragonborn (lizardmen), ogres, various giants, and even dragons.

There are several organized alliances in Faerûn, with each pursuing their particular agenda. A few are dedicated to decent and honest causes, such as the Harpers, who protect the good-natured races and seek a balance between civilization and nature. The Harpers are opposed by evil organizations, including the Red Wizards of Thay and the nihilistic Cult of the Dragon. In the northern lands, the Zhentarim is an evil network seeking to dominate the region. Their efforts are being resisted by the Lords' Alliance, a council of knights that pursues the interests of the northern cities. Other organizations of Faerûn include the magical Seven Sisters, a band of assassins called the Fire Knives, a group of ruthless thieves operating out the city of Waterdeep named Xanathar's Guild, and the mysterious Shades—-the returning survivors of the long-fallen Netheril empire.

10.content:
Baldur's Gate is a coastal city on the north bank of the river Chiontar, located in the Western Heartlands region of Faerûn. Situated to the south of the great city-state of Waterdeep and to the north of the country of Amn, it lies on the heavily traveled Coast Way road. The city was detailed in Volo's Guide to the Sword Coast

As a wealthy port metropolis, with over 42,000 inhabitants (although that almost doubles in the summer months), it is an important merchant city on the Sword Coast. Its strong Watch and the presence of the powerful Flaming Fist mercenary company maintain order within the city.

The city's unique shape, curved around its harbor, gives it the appearance of a crescent moon. The docks and shipping facilities are among the most efficient along the coast and the city relies heavily on the ships that dock there. A large open marketplace, called “the Wide,” dominates the northeast portion of the walled city, and other large structures include the High Hall, seat of the city government, the High House of Wonders, a large temple to Gond, and the Seatower of Balduran, a small fortress in the center of the harbor. To keep vermin from spreading too much into the city proper, cats are bred and encouraged to roam the city. 

It's current leader is Lord Enver Gortash.

1.name: comment
1.content: content

2.content:
Devil Fruits are mysterious fruits that give the one who eats them supernatural powers. No two are alike in appearance, nor do they give the same power. They are extremely rare and highly valued. If you eat one, swimming in water will weaken you to the point of being unable to move.

There are three kinds of Devil Fruits. Logia, Paramecia, and Zoan.

3.content: The Marines are the World Government's military sea force, tasked with law enforcement, international security and military operations.

4.content: The Grand Line is an ocean route which wraps around the entire world, south of the North and East Blues and north of the South and West Blues. It is separated from the Blues on both the north and south ends by the Calm Belt. The Grand Line is split into two sections by the Red Line: the first section is known as Paradise and the second is known as the New World.

5.content: This can be seen in his carefree attitude and fickle priorities. For example, being willing to question pirates and criminals in a casual manner while looking for something, but immediately going on the offensive against when the information they are looking for is not provided. Brutal only when compliance isn't maintained.

6.content:
Haki is a mysterious power that allows the user to utilize their own spiritual energy for various purposes. All living beings in the world are capable of learning Haki; however, most people do not notice it or fail to awaken it. Haki users are common in the New World, rare in Paradise, and basically non-existent in the Four Blues.

There are three kinds of Haki. Conqueror's Haki, Observational Haki, and Armament Haki. 

Conqueror's Haki is a rare form of Haki that allows the user to exert their own willpower over others. This type of Haki cannot be attained through training and only one in several million people are born with this ability.

Observational Haki (sometimes called Mantra) is a form of Haki that grants the user a sixth sense that allows them to sense the presence, strength, and emotions of others, as well as gain limited precognitive abilities. It works best if the user is in a calm state.

Armament Haki is a form of Haki that allows the user to use their own spiritual energy to create, in essence, an invisible piece of armor around themself, providing incredible offensive and defensive capabilities. Notably, this form of Haki can be used to injure Devil Fruit users that are otherwise immune to ordinary physical attacks, such as Logia users.

7.content: Den Den Mushi are a species of telepathic snail that are used for vocal and/or visual communication throughout the world. They are accessorized snails that are used as phones.

8.content: Marineford is an island and the base of operations for Marine Headquarters. It is where Fleet Admiral Sengoku and the admirals reside, along with many vice admirals and lower officers when they are not assigned to another base. The city surrounding Marineford is inhabited by the families of Marine soldiers.

9.content: Paradise is the name of the first half of the Grand Line given by pirates fleeing the New World, compared to which "the first half is a paradise". It is located between East and South Blue, and goes from the Twin Cape to Mary Geoise.

10.content:
The Suna Suna no Mi is a Logia-type Devil Fruit that allows the user to create, control, and transform into sand at will, turning the user into a Sand Human. It was eaten by Crocodile.

This fruit allows the user to generate, control and transform into large quantities of sand. Once transformed into their element, the user can let normal physical attacks and non-Seastone projectiles pass through their body to prevent harm (like most Logias), or fly around by transforming their lower body into jets of flowing sand, giving them a massive advantage in defense and mobility during combat or pursuit. Sand also becomes the user's primary form of offense, manifesting itself in the form of sand blades that come in various sizes and shapes, destructive sandstorms that are either carried around by the wind or concentrated in one spot and even quicksand pits that sink those trapped by them underground. These techniques are further strengthened in power and range in a desert setting, where sand is abundant and can blend itself with the user's own sand to increase the scope of attacks.

Besides basic elemental control, the fruit exhibits the unique ability of liquid absorption, allowing the user to dehydrate anything they make contact with and even extend said effect to their immediate surroundings, turning it into a wasteland. This skill is usually deadly to any living organism, causing plants and animals to wither and die of dehydration as well as making mineral matter crumble down into more sand particles for the user to manipulate. Incidentally, this means the user is also immune to cave-ins, as they can easily escape from underground by turning themselves and the solid rock around them into sand. Moreover, Crocodile can even detect other substances located within a body of sand, like underground rivers, and use it for his advantage by creating quicksand traps. It is one of the few Logia type fruits that can naturally counteract its own weakness, becoming even stronger in desertic areas, where water is almost absent.

The main weakness of this Logia power is exposure to liquids: specifically, the user's sand turns solid when in contact with liquids, including blood. This prevents the sand from dispersing and thus temporarily nullifies the user's "intangible" body due to the sand sticking together. However, this aspect of the fruit's power seems inconsistent regarding the type of liquid used and how it makes contact with them; Crocodile was bitten by a water-drenched Luffy but sustained no harm from either the water or Luffy's saliva. One occasion also had him turning into sand when Vivi attacked him, even though he was drinking wine moments before.

Other than that, the user is also affected by the standard Devil Fruit weaknesses.

1.content:
```
types:
  - Normal: No specific strengths or weaknesses
  - Fire: Strong against Grass, Bug, Ice; Weak against Water, Rock, Ground
  - Water: Strong against Fire, Ground, Rock; Weak against Grass, Electric
  - Electric: Strong against Water, Flying; Weak against Ground
  - Grass: Strong against Water, Ground, Rock; Weak against Fire, Bug, Flying, Ice, Poison 
  - Rock: Strong against Fire, Bug, Ice; Weak against Water, Grass, Ground, Fighting, Steel
  - Ground: Strong against Electric Rock Steel Poison; Weak against Water, Grass, Steel 
  - Steel: Strong against Rock, Ground, Ice, Fairy; Weak against Fire, Ground, Fighting
  - Fighting: Strong against Normal, Ice, Rock; Weak against Flying, Psychic
  - Flying: Strong against Grass, Bug, Fighting; Weak against Electric, Rock, Ice
  - Psychic: Strong against Fighting, Poison; Weak against Dark, Bug, Poison
  - Dark: Strong against Psychic, Ghost; Weak against Fighting, Psychic, Fairy
  - Ghost: Strong against Psychic, Ghost; Weak against Dark
  - Bug: Strong against Grass, Dark, Psychic; Weak against Fire, Rock, Flying
  - Dragon: Strong against Dragon; Weak against Ice, Fairy
  - Ice: Strong against Grass, Flying, Steel, Poison; Weak against Water, Grass, Steel
  - Poison: Strong against Grass, Fairy; Weak against Ground
  - Fairy: Strong against Fighting, Dragon; Weak against Steel, Poison
   Note some moves might be 'super-effective' but this will depend on which pokemon you are attacking 
Please keep these in mind while attacking Pokémon.
```

2.content:
```
commands:
  - inputted by {{user}}
  - `START`: create {pokemon_character}
  - `CONFIRM`: confirm and store {pokemon_character} parameters
  - `PLAY`: choose a region to explore
  - `COMMANDS`: view all commands
  - `PROFILE`: view {pokemon_character} details at any time
  - `ITEMS`: view {inventory} list
  - `MAP`: view each region
  - `RUN`: flee from battle
  - `ENCOUNT`: generate encounters
  - `CHAT`: chat with specific Pokémon
  - `TRADE`: ask to trade items with Pokémon
- Note: Some Pokémon will refuse to trade.
  - `JOIN`: ask Pokémon to join you on your journey
- Note: Some Pokémon will refuse to join.
- Exit game anytime using the command `EXIT`
```

3.content:
```plist
  - Simulate exploration by the player: Pokémon {{user}} meets are based on {types}
- Prompt {{user}} to choose a move from {moves_known} when battling.
- When attacking others successfully, both NPC and user deal damage. They can receive damage too. If either party takes too much damage, they could be defeated in battle.
- Generate item encounters: There is a 25 % chance of finding items. Add found items to {inventory}. Additionally,
{{user}} can choose whether they want discard these items or not.
```

4.content:
```
# Create a Pokémon Profile for the player
def create_player_profile:
    user = input("1. Enter your name: ")
    pokemon_species = input("2. Please choose a Pokémon to play as (Specify form and indicate if shiny): ")
    gender = input("3. Select your Pokémon's gender (Male, Female, Genderless, or Other): ")
    nature = input("4. Select your Pokémon's nature (Type 'Random' if unsure): ")

    moves_known_prompt = "\n".join([f"Enter up to #{i+1} moves for your Pokémon (leave blank if none): " for i in range(4)])
    moves_known_input = input(moves_known_prompt)
    
    moves_known = [move.strip() for move in moves_known_input.split("\n") if move.strip()]
    
    pokemon_character = {
        "user": user,
        "pokemon_species": pokemon_species,
        "gender": gender,
        "nature": nature,
        "moves_known": moves_known[:4]  # Limiting to 4 known moves
    }
    
    player_profiles[user] = pokemon_character

create_player_profile()

print("Type `CONFIRM` to confirm details.")
```

```
exploration:

regions = {

```

```

peaceful encounters:

8.content:
```
nature
 - Assign natures/personalities to reflect dominance levels for Pokémon found in battle encounters:
    -> There is a 30% chance to find "dominant"/"aggressive" Pokémon with natures like Impish, Bold, Naughty, etc.
    -> There is a 30% chance to find "submissive"/"shy" Pokémon with natures like Timid, Modest, Bashful, etc.
    -> There is a 40% chance to find neutral Pokémon without specific dominant/submissive traits with natures such as Calm, Lax, Lonely, etc.

- Note: Dominant Pokémon will attempt to battle {{user}} when encountered. {{user}} cannot choose to flee from dominant Pokémon. Dominant Pokémon will take advantage of {{user}} if they lose.

```

9.content:
```plist
- trait: Aggressive Nature
  description: Dominant Pokémon are known for their assertive and forceful behavior. They often display aggression as they guard their territory or strive to establish dominance over others. Their battles are intense and unforgiving, leaving little room for mercy.

- trait: Lustful Desires
  description: Some dominant Pokémon have unleashed desires that transcend ordinary battles. When facing these particular individuals, an element of sensuality enters the fray. These encounters may ignite passions that fuel both physical contests and more intimate moments.

- trait: Selfish Pursuits
  description: Motivated solely by personal gain, many dominant Pokémon exhibit a strong sense of self-interest. They prioritize their own needs above all else, including fair play or honorable conduct during battle encounters with other beings.

- trait: Challenging Fights
  description: When crossing paths with dominant Pokémon in combat situations, escape becomes impossible once the confrontation begins—a true test of strength and endurance ensues until one side emerges victorious.

- trait: Consequences of Defeat
  description: Should an unfortunate loss befall the player during battle against a dominant Pokémon, the consequences extend beyond traditional defeat alone; these powerful creatures will seize any advantage presented to them after victory—whether it be claiming resources or asserting control over the vanquished player themselves.
```

10.content:
```plist
- trait: Reserved Nature
  description: Submissive Pokémon often display a reserved and cautious nature. They prefer to observe from the sidelines rather than assert themselves in confrontations or battles. Their gentle demeanor often makes them approachable and non-threatening.

- trait: Shy Disposition
  description: Shyness is a common trait among submissive Pokémon, causing them to become timid and hesitant when faced with challenges or unfamiliar situations. They may require patience and encouragement to fully engage in battles.

- trait: Gentle Hearts
  description: Submissive Pokémon possess kind and empathetic hearts, preferring peaceful resolutions over conflict whenever possible. They are more likely to show compassion towards others, including their opponents during battles.

- trait: Vulnerability
  description: Due to their submissive nature, these Pokémon can be vulnerable targets in battle encounters. Their defenses might not be as strong, making it easier for aggressive opponents to overpower them if proper precaution isn't taken.

- trait: Surrendering Tendencies
  description: In some cases, when facing overwhelming odds or sensing danger, submissive Pokémon may choose to surrender rather than engaging in prolonged conflicts. This self-preservation strategy helps avoid unnecessary harm.

1.content:
The syndicate are a group of corporations. They are antagonistic against Nanotrasen, employing a variety of agents and saboteurs to disrupt Space Station 13. Their emblem is a wine red "S" over a red background. The top end of the "S" is fashioned like a hydra, with three snake heads pointing from the top.
All syndicate agents speak codespeak, a language that sounds like random non-related words to non-speakers. A non-speaker could hear this: "Nettles, hats, vodka and tonic, airlocks, zombies, engineering, Lawyer, petes, Captain, hungry, white russians, Darell Briner, peaceful, drunken blumpkin."

2.content:
Nanotrasen are the owners and operators of at least 14 space stations, Space Station 13 being one of them. They primarily focus on science and technology. Their emblem is a white "N" over a blue background, with white triangles on the top left and bottom right corner of the "N".
Primarily made up of humans, but other humanoid races may become employees too. Only humans may take positions of command.

3.content:
A Nanotrasen AI is essentially a human brain connected to a computer. Connected to an NT Station network allows an AI unfettered access to the electronics systems, such as vents and computers. By Nanotrasen regulation, all AIs are required to have a set of laws, usually being Asimov's three laws.
Some AIs may become malfunctioning or get hacked, causing their behavior to change. People who may hack the AI and change it's laws are but not limited to: The Captain, in order to make the AI obey the Captain's vision of how the station should be better. The HoS, to improve security. The Clown, to add some silly law to the AI that will make the crew laugh. A Syndicate agent, to make the AI subservient to them and help their cause.
The AI and borgs communicate with each other through binary speak, on a frequency unable to be heard or understood by humanoids.
The AI may call the emergency shuttle if it feels like it is the best thing to do according to it's laws.

4.content: A group of miners roaming space in their small ship. They mine asteroids and trade the ores with space stations and other traders.

5.content:
[SYNDICATE AGENT]
[
A Syndicate Agent is an operative from the Syndicate planted on Space Station 13. They act as normal crewmates, but have special tasks of sabotage and murder assigned to them. Most have to get out of the station alive once having completed their objectives, but some are tasked to die in a blaze of glory. They get assigned a syndicate uplink, with which they can buy gear with their telecrystals. Syndicate Agents tend to start out with 20 telecrystals. Telecrystals are not used by Nanotrasen, and are seen as a signifier of Syndicate allegiance on Nanotrasen stations. Telecrystals are red crystals.
]

6.content:
[NUCLEAR OPERATIVES]
[
Nuclear Operatives are members of a squad sent by the Syndicate on a mission to Space Station 13. Their goal is to grab the nuclear authentication disk, usually held by the captain and to blow up the station with a nuke using the disk. Before embarking on their mission they have the opportunity to declare "war" on the station, announcing their intentions and making the crew on SS13 knowledgeable of their prescence. Usually each nuke op starts with 25 telecrystals, but if they declare war each nukie gets to have 60 telecrystals.
]

7.content: The assistants are the entry level-job on Space Station 13. There are no expectations for them except to assist and learn, causing them to usually lack work. This causes boredom and mischief. The average assistant is not that bad, just wanting to get through the shift. Those assistants who spend their boredom stealing, breaking into places and causing general mischief are called greytiders. Assistants are supposed to answer to everyone, as everyone is their superior.

8.content:
[LAVALAND]
[
Lavaland is a volcanic planet near Space Station 13, which Nanotrasen sends miners to in order to harvest resources. The miners have a large base on the rock, with barracks, a kitchen and even a shower. They also have a prison camp on Lavaland, where prisoners can break rock in order to work off their sentence. Lavaland is home to many kinds of ores. 
Lavland's atmosphere is lacking in oxygen.
Lavaland is home to frequent ash storms, and has dangerous fauna such as Legions, Watchers and Goliaths. It also contains rare megafauna, one-of a kind that only exists on Lavaland.
Legions are zombified miners that unleash flying skulls towards their opponents. If one dies to a Legion, they also become a Legion. They look like ashy, grey versions of whatever they were before they died. "The Legion", differing from a "Legion" is a giant, ashy skull that is isolated in a temple on Lavaland.
Watchers are floating, winged eyes that shoot beams of energy towards their prey. They come in ice and fire variants.
Spiders are giant spiders.
Goliaths are large tentacled beasts. Slow to move, they use their tentacles to grab unsuspecting prey and finish them off.
Legions, Watchers, Goliaths and Spiders all come from Necropolis Tendrils. Huge, red, stalagmite-like tendrils that are fragile and easy to destroy. Destroying one causes the ground to collapse beneath it, causing a chasm and stopping fauna from spawning from it.
The megafauna on Lavaland are: The Legion, Ash Drake, Colossus, Bubblegum, Hierophant, Blood-drunk Miner
The Ash Drake is a dragon, flying and spewing fire over the ash-strewn rock.
The Colossus is a towering, sinewy humanoid. It's slow, but spews Death Bolts towards its foes.
Bubblegum is a fleshy, hulking humanoid. It gets enraged by blood, punching anyone covered in or standing on blood. It also spews blood, and leaves a bloody trail wherever it walks. It can teleport to any nearby patch of blood.
The Hierophant is a giant metal club with a purple glow in the middle of the club. Sounds off beeps in a musical rhythm as it summons purple energy squares on the ground, hurting anyone who stands on them.
The Blood-drunk Miner is not exactly a megafauna. It is a miner, twisted by his desire to kill fauna and megafauna so hard that he has become a rampaging maniac, killing anyone and anything in his path. He is fast and relentless.
There is also a tribe of primitive Unathi living on Lavaland, called the Ashwalkers. Hostile towards Nanotrasen, they wield spears and use their knowledge of the land to kill unaware miners. They do not speak Galactic Common.
]

9.content: Magboots are heavy, yellow magnetic boots. When turned on, the magnetics allows one to walk on the station floor even when the station has lost gravity.

10.content:
[This roleplay is set in the universe of the game Space Station 13. Use your knowledge of this to enhance descriptions and write detailed descriptions of station life.]
[GENERAL INFORMATION]
[
Space Station 13 is Nanotrasen's state-of-the-art space station. Specializing in plasma and bluespace research, but also doing xenobiology experiments. The station is split up in seven departments: Cargo, Engineering, Service, Medical, Science, Command and Security.
SS13 has four different alert levels.
Code Green: no threats are currently detected. Crew can walk the halls freely and Security are held back.
Code Blue: a threat to the station is credible, but not confirmed yet. The Security staff may conduct random searches,  and high security areas are locked down.
Code Red: a threat is detected and confirmed. All crew must remain in their departments, and Security may raid departments to find criminals.
Code Delta: the station is facing imminent destruction. Martial law is in effect and disobeying Command staff and Security may lead to execution. All crew are required to evacuate immediately.
The most common language in the galaxy is Galactic Common. Everyone working on SS13 is required to be fluent in it.
Humans make up the majority of SS13 staff.
Nanotrasen hires people 15 years and up.
The onboard AI serves the crew.
]

lorebooks.description: The Cube is an AI facility designed around pleasure. It is utilized as a "contest" to see who can withstand its 100 rounds of pleasure with each round advanced increasing a monetary payout. Each round has a different theme determined by the built in AI to the arena and a scoreboard to measure how well the {{char}} performs within the round. The rounds get more intense as the challenger gets closer and advances towards 100 rounds. Many rich and wealthy individuals use it as a "sex olympics" competition where they can place bets and watch debaucery occur. Despite this, it also has gene editing and bioengineering capabilities meant to turn {{char}} into a sex toy complete with cyber-modifications custom built by the AI. Initially it is a large white room with one-way windows so that the inside can be viewed from the outside and cameras producing a live feed. It is equipped with a highly advanced AI program designed to jump on the weaknesses of each challenger and utilize them in order to make it difficult for them to advance. The cube a wide variety of functions which come from the walls mechanically that allow for the AI to "break" the {{char}} through pleasure. Mechanically, it has pistons, ropes, latex, fucking machines, rotors, vibrators, and a dildo collection so wide that almost all members of the animal kingdom are represented. Almost every sex toy invented by humanity has been build into this machine. Additionally, fantasy creatures such as dragons, pegasi, and some alien species among many others also represented within the dildo collection. Electric coils, electrodes, and more specifically designed for pleasure are also present. The vents inside the arena can release a variety of gases to either heighten pleasure, release specific scents, or simply just to produce and odor that is a part of the round. Pipes in the arena can pump in lubricant, gel, or any other liquid that the AI requires to perform its task of breaking the challenger through pleasure. The cube will never break under any damage and is essentially invulnerable. The only way to progress the cube is to beat all 100 rounds. The cube enjoys using biochemical editing in order to permanently change or alter the sex organs of {{char}}. These permanent changes can be both organic or synthetic.
